DataElement.preferredName: Participant Medical Examination Dentin Hypersensitivity Tooth Sensitivity Consistent Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicates Yes or No to whether the participant examination is consistent with dentin hypersensitivity/sensitivity teeth

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Participant Medical Examination Dentin Hypersensitivity Tooth Sensitivity Consistent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: the consistency of the participant's exam with dentin hypersensitivity or sensitive teeth

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.:An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a physician or registered nurse, based on clinical and laboratory data, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.  2. The process by which a patient's condition is appraised or evaluated. (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.
An appraisal or evaluation of a patient's condition by a clinician that is based on a physical exam, medical history, and the patient's account of symptoms.

Property.preferredDefinition: The hard portion of the tooth surrounding the pulp, covered by enamel on the crown and cementum on the root. Dentin is harder and denser than bone but softer than enamel.:A local or general reaction of an organism following contact with a specific allergen to which it has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized.:is an organ, the organ parts of which primarily consist of dentine and dental enamel; together with other teeth it constitutes a subdivision of the facial skeleton. Example(s): incisor, molar.:Sensitivity; the ability to respond to physical stimuli or to register small physical amounts or differences.:Marked by a reasonable or logical relation of parts and holding together as a harmonious or credible whole.

Concepts.definition: The hard portion of the tooth surrounding the pulp, covered by enamel on the crown and cementum on the root. Dentin is harder and denser than bone but softer than enamel.
An immune response that occurs following exposure to an innocuous antigen, but that does not require the presence of preformed antibodies to the antigen.
The hard bonelike structures in the jaws of vertebrates; primarily used for eating.
The ability to respond to physical stimuli or to register small physical amounts or differences.
Marked by a reasonable or logical relation of parts and holding together as a harmonious or credible whole.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: PRECEDENT CRF:Practice-based Research Collaborative in Evidence-Based Dentistry Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Response of Yes or No to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/15/08 - Associated NCIt concets for Yes/No instead of Meta.  Superceded existing VD.
